tabs.header: Researchers in academia, industry and government
tabs.description: Identify and cite the standards, databases or repositories that exist for your discipline when creating a data management plan, releasing data or submitting a manuscript to a journal...
tabs.title: Researchers

tabs.description: Make your standard, database or repository discoverable, increasing exposure and credit outside your immediate community and promoting adoption...
tabs.title: Developers & Curators

tabs.description: Create and maintain an interrelated list of citable standards, databases and repositories to recommend to your authors, users or their community, and revise this recommendation over time...
tabs.title: Journal Publishers

tabs.description: Use FAIRsharing to provide a foundation on which to create or enrich educational lectures, training and teaching material, and to plug into data management planning tools...
tabs.title: Librarians & Trainers

tabs.description: Raise awareness around standards, databases, repositories and data policies, as well as mobilise your community to take action to promote the registration, use and citation of key resources...
tabs.title: Societies & Alliances

tabs.description: Recommend FAIRsharing to your awardees to inform the development of their data management plan, and select the appropriate resources to recommend in your data policy...
tabs.title: Funders
